item.title: 阿根廷推出航空改革，希望引进外国航空公司
item.description: 阿根廷政府周三公布了一项旨在开放该国航空业的全面法令，邀请外国航空公司进入长期由国营航空公司阿根廷航空公司（Aerolineas Argentinas）主导的市场。【原文：The Argentine government published a sweeping decree on Wednesday aimed at opening up the country's aviation sector, inviting foreign airlines to enter the market long dominated by state-run carrier Aerolineas Argentinas.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利看好特斯拉的能源存储部门
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）上调了对特斯拉储能业务的估值，预计人工智能热潮将推动全球电力需求激增，该公司有能力扩大其在该领域的市场份额。【原文：Morgan Stanley raised its valuation for Tesla's energy storage business, expecting a global surge in demand for power driven by the artificial-intelligence boom, and the company's ability to grow its market share in the segment.】

item.title: 美国和墨西哥采取行动挫败中国规避美国钢铝关税的行为
item.description: 美国和墨西哥周三宣布采取新措施，打击中国和其他通过墨西哥运输产品的国家规避美国钢铝关税的行为，实施北美钢材 "熔化和浇铸 "标准。【原文：The U.S. and Mexico on Wednesday announced new steps to fight the circumvention of U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum by China and other countries that ship products through Mexico, implementing a North American "melted and poured" standard for steel.】

item.title: 研究显示：通胀挤压预算，美国 Z 世代消费者依赖父母
item.description: 美国银行周三发布的一份报告显示，由于通货膨胀和生活成本上升，美国 Z 世代成年人面临着越来越大的财务挑战，其中 46% 的人依赖父母和家人的经济援助。【原文：Gen Z adults in the U.S. face increasing financial challenges because of inflation and rising living costs, with 46% relying on financial assistance from their parents and families, according to a report by Bank of America published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 三星在可折叠手机中加强人工智能，在智能手表和戒指中加强健康监测
item.description: 三星电子周三发布了最新款可折叠智能手机，使其最昂贵的旗舰机型变得更轻、更薄，并增强了人工智能功能，以挑战苹果在高端市场的主导地位。【原文：Samsung Electronics unveiled its latest foldable smartphones on Wednesday, making its priciest flagship model lighter and slimmer and bolstering AI functions as it challenges Apple's dominance in the premium market.】

item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）与商场所有者西蒙地产公司（Simon Property）就 900 多个电动汽车充电器签订协议
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）的一个部门与商场所有者西蒙地产集团（Simon Property Group）签署了一项协议，将在全美 75 个地点安装和运营 900 多个高速电动汽车充电器。【原文：A unit of BP signed a deal with mall owner Simon Property Group to install and operate more than 900 high-speed electric-vehicle chargers at 75 sites across the United States, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田加入汽车制造商集团，帮助建设电动汽车充电网络
item.description: 丰田公司周三表示，丰田已经加入了一个主要汽车制造商集团，支持电动汽车充电公司 IONNA，该公司正在北美建设一个大功率电动汽车充电网络。【原文：Toyota has joined a group of major automakers to back electric vehicle charging firm, IONNA, which is building a high-powered EV charging network across North America, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 2027 年末是欧洲股市震荡的 "现实 "日期
item.description: 欧盟监管听证会周三获悉，欧盟和英国股票市场通过将交易结算时间缩短一半来追赶华尔街的协调行动，有可能在 2027 年底实现。【原文：A coordinated move by stock markets in the European Union and Britain to catch up with Wall Street by halving the settlement time for transactions could realistically happen in late 2027, an EU regulatory hearing was told on Wednesday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯交易商敲定股份交换，Yandex 分拆接近完成
item.description: 俄罗斯交易商已敲定为 Yandex（常被称为俄罗斯的谷歌）的投资者进行股份交换，这是完成超过 50 亿美元交易所需的最后步骤之一，当地投资者将控制这家技术公司的大部分业务。【原文：Russian traders have finalised a share exchange for investors in Yandex, often dubbed Russia's Google, one of the final steps needed to complete a more than $5 billion deal that will see local investors take control of the bulk of the technology company's business.】

item.title: 由于房地产风险抑制了回购，美国地区性银行将面临更严格的审查
item.description: 分析师表示，由于商业房地产（CRE）贷款的损失预计将给银行盈利带来压力，美国地区性银行可能会储备更多的雨天资金，并在股票回购方面保持保守。【原文：U.S. regional banks will probably stockpile more rainy-day funds and stay conservative on stock buybacks as losses from commercial real estate (CRE) loans are expected to pressure their earnings, analysts said.】

item.title: 欧佩克坚持 2024 年石油需求观点，认为旅游旺季强劲
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）周三坚持其对2024年和明年全球石油需求相对强劲增长的预测，称强劲的经济增长和航空旅行将支持夏季的燃料使用。【原文：OPEC stuck to its forecast for relatively strong growth in global oil demand in 2024 and next year, saying on Wednesday that resilient economic growth and strong air travel would support fuel use in the summer months.】

item.title: 保时捷股价升至 DAX 指数榜首，交易商关注收盘前电话交易
item.description: 在停电期开始前，保时捷公司与投资者进行了一次电话沟通，交易员们对保时捷经纪人的积极评论给予了高度评价，此后，豪华汽车制造商保时捷公司的股价上涨了 3.4%，在法兰克福蓝筹股 DAX 指数中名列前茅。【原文：Shares in luxury carmaker Porsche AG are up 3.4% at the top of Frankfurt's blue-chip DAX index after traders points to positive brokerage comments following a call with investors prior to the start of the blackout period.】

item.title: 中国和巴西将试行牛肉溯源计划
item.description: 中国是世界上最大的牛肉进口国，而巴西则是最大的牛肉供应国，两国将建立一个试点计划，作为使牛肉生产更具可持续性的努力的一部分。【原文：China, the world's largest beef importer and Brazil, the biggest supplier, will set up a pilot scheme as part of efforts to make beef production more sustainable, state media said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 3M 首席财务官帕托拉瓦拉将于 7 月底离职
item.description: 3M 公司周三表示，其首席财务官 Monish Patolawala 将于本月底离职，另谋高就。【原文：3M said on Wednesday its CFO Monish Patolawala would leave the company at the end of the month to pursue another opportunity.】

item.title: 独家报道以色列银行在推出数字谢克尔之前等待数字欧元的到来
item.description: 以色列银行（BOI）仍致力于数字谢克尔货币计划，以改善以色列的支付系统并促进创新，但不太可能先于其他先进经济体推出数字谢克尔货币。【原文：The Bank of Israel (BOI) remains committed to plans for a digital shekel currency to improve Israel's payments system and foster innovation, but is unlikely to launch one ahead of other advanced economies.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，霍尼韦尔将以 18 亿美元收购空气产品公司的液化天然气业务
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，工业巨头霍尼韦尔将以 18 亿美元现金收购空气产品公司的液化天然气工艺技术和设备业务。【原文：Industrial giant Honeywell will buy Air Products' liquefied natural-gas process technology and equipment business for $1.8 billion in cash, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英伟达和其他大型企业股涨势不减，期货走高
item.description: 周三，随着权重最大的股票在盘前交易中上涨，S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货也随之上涨，而市场则在等待美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的评论以及本周晚些时候的重要事件，以寻找更多方向。【原文：Futures for the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq gained on Wednesday as the most heavily weighted stocks rose in premarket trading, while markets awaited comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and key events later in the week for more direction.】

item.title: 投资者押注政府支出，太空初创企业融资持续复苏
item.description: 英国投资公司 Seraphim Space 的数据显示，4 月至 6 月，太空初创企业吸引了 24.1 亿美元的全球投资，连续第三个季度实现融资增长。【原文：Space startups attracted $2.41 billion in global investments from April to June, marking a third consecutive quarter of growth in funding, according to British investment firm Seraphim Space.】

item.title: 早间竞价：中国避开通货紧缩，新西兰放鸽子，市场趋于平静
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 夏日炎炎，美国零售商试图将返校购物时间推迟到七月
item.description: 尽管美国儿童可能希望暑假永远不要结束，但零售商却希望返校季比以往任何时候都更早开始--最好是现在--并在亚马逊的 Prime Day 之前确定促销时间。【原文：While American children may wish summer vacation would never end, retailers want back-to-school season to start earlier than ever -- preferably now -- and are timing promotions ahead of Amazon's Prime Day.】

item.title: 聚焦：全球锂行业关注阿根廷盐滩的技术试运行
item.description: 在阿根廷北部山区的一个尘土飞扬的平原上，两层楼高的黑色管道将从地下深处吸来的盐水注入一个巨大的罐中。【原文：In a dusty plain in northern Argentina's mountains, black tubes stretching two stories high fill a massive tank with salty brine sucked from deep below ground.】

item.title: 独家报道分析发现，大多数患者在两年内停止使用 Wegovy 和 Ozempic 减肥药
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份美国药房索赔分析报告显示，两年后，只有四分之一的美国患者仍在服用诺和诺德的Wegovy或Ozempic减肥药。【原文：Only one in four U.S. patients prescribed Novo Nordisk’s Wegovy or Ozempic for weight loss were still taking the popular medications two years later, according to an analysis of U.S. pharmacy claims provided to Reuters that also showed a steady decline in use over time.】

item.title: 克莱斯勒因前座安全气囊故障召回 33.2 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，由于前座安全气囊存在潜在问题，可能无法按预期展开，克莱斯勒将在美国召回33.2万辆阿尔法-罗密欧、吉普和菲亚特汽车。【原文：Chrysler is recalling 332,000 Alfa Romeo, Jeep, and Fiat vehicles in the United States due to a potential issue with the front seat air bags, which may not deploy as intended, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 宝马因驾驶员安全气囊故障召回约 39.4 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，德国汽车制造商宝马公司将因驾驶员安全气囊故障在美国召回394029辆汽车。【原文：German carmaker BMW will recall 394,029 vehicles in the United States over faulty driver airbags, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 随着全球饮酒习惯的改变，烈酒将超越葡萄酒
item.description: 世界烈酒联盟（World Spirits Alliance）周三发布的一份报告预测，随着人们饮酒偏好的改变，伏特加和威士忌等烈酒的全球销量将超过葡萄酒。【原文：More cases of spirits such as vodka and whisky than of wine are set to be sold globally, a report from the World Spirits Alliance predicted on Wednesday, as drinking preferences have shifted.】

item.title: 由于消费下滑，中国第二季度 GDP 可能失去复苏动力：路透社民意调查
item.description: 由于消费需求低迷，中国第二季度经济可能同比增长5.1%，与前三个月的强劲开局相比有所放缓，这使人们继续预期中国政府将需要采取更多刺激措施。【原文：China's economy likely grew 5.1% in the second quarter from a year earlier, slowing from a strong start in the first three months due to sluggish consumer demand, keeping alive expectations Beijing will need to unleash more stimulus.】

item.title: 独家报道中国加强对四大审计公司的审查
item.description: 三位知情人士称，中国财政部正在对四大审计公司为本地公司所做的工作进行更严格的检查，因为人们担心审计师在揭露企业不法行为方面做得不够。【原文：China's Ministry of Finance is conducting more rigorous checks of work done by the Big Four auditing firms for local companies, three people with knowledge of the matter said, amid concerns auditors are not doing enough to uncover corporate wrongdoing.】

item.title: 论文称：为保护股票价值，需要采取积极的气候行动
item.description: 智囊机构EDHEC-风险气候影响组织在周三发表的一份长达74页的文件中警告说，决策者如果想避免全球股票价值损失高达50%，就应该采取积极的政策来控制气候变化。【原文：Decision makers should pursue aggressive policies to bring climate change under control if they want to avoid losses in the value of global stocks that could top 50%, think-tank EDHEC-Risk Climate Impact warned in a 74-page paper published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 惠誉分析师称日本信用状况将受益于利率上升
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）的日本主权分析师告诉路透社记者，尽管公共财政面临更大压力，但日本的物价上涨和利率上调可能会使债务膨胀并提高生产率，从而有利于该国的信用状况。【原文：Japan's price increases and higher interest rates could benefit the country's credit profile by inflating debt away and promoting productivity despite higher pressure on public finances, Fitch Ratings' Japan sovereign analyst told Reuters.】

item.title: 电动汽车需求下滑影响奔驰第二季度销量
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）汽车制造商周三表示，由于对电池电动汽车的需求下滑，该公司第二季度的销量下降了 6%。【原文：Mercedes-Benz saw a 6% decline in sales in the second quarter as demand for battery-electric vehicles slumped, the carmaker said on Wednesday, promising to make up lost ground with improved availability and market launches.】
